content.user_title: Enable AI Pair Programming with Role Switching
content.value_statement: Traditional solo coding lacks real-time feedback and collaboration benefits. This skill transforms Claude into an intelligent pair programming partner with multiple modes including driver, navigator, and automatic role switching for enhanced code quality and learning.
actual_capabilities: Switch between driver mode where you write code with AI guidance and navigator mode where AI writes code with your direction
Automatic role switching at configurable intervals with context preservation and smooth handoffs
Real-time code verification with quality scoring and automatic rollback on failures
Generate comprehensive test suites with coverage tracking and continuous testing integration
Perform security scanning, performance analysis, and code complexity monitoring during development
Configure multiple AI agent personalities including senior developer, TDD specialist, debugger expert, and mentor modes
limitations: Requires claude-flow CLI tool to be installed and configured on your system
This skill provides command documentation only and does not execute commands directly
Quality verification features depend on having appropriate testing frameworks and linters installed
Session persistence and metrics tracking require proper git repository setup

best_practices: Define clear session objectives before starting and choose the appropriate mode based on task type such as driver for learning, navigator for rapid prototyping, or TDD for test-first development
Enable verification with appropriate thresholds for critical code paths and always review truth scores before committing changes to ensure quality standards are met
Take regular breaks every 45-60 minutes during extended sessions and save session progress periodically to maintain productivity and allow recovery if needed
anti_patterns: Avoid disabling verification for production code even when working quickly as this bypasses quality checks and can introduce bugs or security vulnerabilities
Do not skip test generation when implementing new features as tests serve as documentation and prevent regression issues during future changes
Avoid staying in a single mode for entire long sessions as switching roles provides fresh perspectives and prevents cognitive fatigue from repetitive tasks

faq.question: What is the difference between driver mode and navigator mode?
faq.answer: Driver mode means you write the code while AI provides guidance and suggestions. Navigator mode means AI writes the code while you provide high-level direction and review. Choose driver when learning or controlling implementation details, navigator for rapid prototyping or code generation.

faq.question: How does automatic role switching work in switch mode?
faq.answer: Switch mode automatically alternates between driver and navigator roles at configurable intervals. You receive a 30-second warning before switching, complete your current thought, then roles swap with a context summary to maintain continuity. Default interval is 10 minutes.

faq.question: What is truth score verification and when should I use it?
faq.answer: Truth score is a quality metric from 0 to 1 that evaluates code correctness, test coverage, and best practices. Enable verification with high thresholds for critical code. Scores above 0.95 are good, above 0.98 are excellent. Failed verification can trigger automatic rollback.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without installing claude-flow CLI?
faq.answer: No, this skill is documentation for the claude-flow CLI tool. You must install claude-flow CLI separately using npm install command. The skill provides comprehensive usage instructions and command references but does not execute commands directly.

faq.question: How does TDD mode differ from regular development modes?
faq.answer: TDD mode enforces test-driven development workflow with three phases: write failing test, implement minimal code to pass, then refactor. It requires tests before implementation and tracks coverage goals. Use TDD mode when building new features with comprehensive testing requirements.

faq.question: What AI agent personalities are available and when should I use each?
faq.answer: Available agents include senior-dev for architecture and patterns, tdd-specialist for testing focus, debugger-expert for problem solving, and junior-dev for learning. Choose based on task needs: senior-dev for refactoring, debugger-expert for fixing issues, tdd-specialist for test coverage.
